acute.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: an acute problem is very serious
acute.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The housing shortage is more acute than first thought.
acute.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: an acute feeling is very strong
acute.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: an acute illness or disease quickly becomes very serious
acute.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: acute senses such as hearing, taste, touch etc are very good and sensitive
acute.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Young children have a particularly acute sense of smell.
acute.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: quick to notice and understand things
acute.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: Simon’s vague manner concealed an acute mind.
an acute analysis of Middle Eastern politics
acute.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: an acute angle is less than 90°
acute.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: an acute accent (=a mark used to show pronunciation) is a small mark written above a vowel. In ‘café’, the letter ‘e’ has an acute accent.
